intro: Astroloma tectum, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive, star-shaped appearance. It is well adapted to arid environments and can tolerate drought conditions. Astroloma tectum is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it thrives in full sun.
